page.title: 14Interview-Mrs. Rimes aged 92
page.content: Mrs. Rimes has lived in Creigiau all her life and was the wife of the station master in the village. The passenger railway (Barry line) started in about 1890. Creigiau station soon became a busy place with passengers walking a considerable distance to board the train for Cardiff, Barry, Pontypridd. The adjacent railway was known as the Taff line which carried coal and limestone to the Cardiff docks. By 1935 there was a signal box by the bridge. The railway was very busy and trains even ran on Sunday. The trains mostly carried coal from the valleys. Coal trains used to run from Pontypridd to Barry. There was another line for the quarry which arrived at 6.00 a.m. and 4.00 p.m. which carried limestone.
